body_html:
Since the official implementation of Inception V3 (here) is based on nn.Module not nn.Sequential and does not have max_pooling as module in itself, so your model (nn.Sequential) would lack some F.max_pooling and x.view in forward computation.

I think you can get inception_v3 middle results by overriding Inception3's forward method.
body_text:
Since the official implementation of Inception V3 (here) is based on nn.Module not nn.Sequential and does not have max_pooling as module in itself, so your model (nn.Sequential) would lack some F.max_pooling and x.view in forward computation.
I think you can get inception_v3 middle results by overriding Inception3's forward method.
body:
Since the official implementation of `Inception V3` ([here](https://github.com/pytorch/vision/blob/master/torchvision/models/inception.py#L71)) is based on `nn.Module` not `nn.Sequential` and does not have `max_pooling` as module in itself, so your model (`nn.Sequential`) would lack some `F.max_pooling` and `x.view` in forward computation.

I think you can get inception_v3 middle results by overriding `Inception3`'s forward method.
